wikipedia_page.main: Jack William Hendry (born 7 May 1995) is a Scottish professional footballer who plays as a centre-back for Belgian First Division A side Club Brugge and for the Scotland national team. Hendry has previously played for Partick Thistle, Wigan Athletic, Dundee, Celtic and K.V. Oostende. He has also had loan spells at Shrewsbury Town, Milton Keynes Dons and A-League club Melbourne City.

response: In October 2013, millionaires and long time Thistle fans Chris and Colin Weir donated £750,000 to Partick Thistle to set up a new advanced youth academy. The academy was named the Thistle Weir Youth Academy and is run by Scott Allison. Graduates of the academy include Livingston defender James Penrice, Queen of the South midfielder Aidan Fitzpatrick, Club Brugge defender Jack Hendry and Hibernian striker Kevin Nisbet.
* Highest transfer fee received: £1,500,000, Jack Hendry to Celtic
John or Jack Hendry or Hendrie may refer to:
*Jack Hendry (footballer, born 1995), Scottish footballer (Celtic FC, Club Brugge, national team)

response: Kusunga, who as a free agent was able to sign outside of the transfer window, signed for Scottish Premiership club Dundee on 2 February 2018. He replaced Jack Hendry, who had been sold to Celtic on 31 January. He was released by Dundee at the end of the 2018–19 season.
